bradleyross.j2ee.servlets

Class ShowSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • bradleyross.j2ee.servlets.ShowSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public class ShowSchema
extends HttpServlet
    Servlet for showing database schema information using DatabaseMetaData.

    This was an earlier attempt to do an autodocumenter for database schemas. There was a later version that also listed indices and foreign keys and used better formatting, and I'm trying to locate it.

    It should be noted that SQL Server does not have a BOOLEAN type but uses an integer value instead for result sets containing boolean data. A value of 0 indicates false while a value of 1 indicates true.

    The servlet uses the init parameters class, system, and account.

    • class is the name of the class that is a subclass of DatabaseProperties that serves to connect the databases.
    • system is the identifier for the database to be used.
    • account is the name of the account to be used.
    Author:
    Bradley Ross
    See Also:
    DatabaseMetaData.getCrossReference(String, String, String, String, String, String), DatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo(String, String, String, boolean, boolean), DatabaseMetaData.getTables(String, String, String, String[]), DatabaseMetaData.getImportedKeys(String, String, String), DatabaseMetaData.getExportedKeys(String, String, String), Serialized Form

        system - Database system for which connection is to be made.
        account - Account name to be used in connecting to the database.

      • isIncluded

        protected boolean isIncluded(DatabaseProperties data,
                 String catalog,
                 String schema,
                 String item)
        Determines whether an item in the database is to be included in the reports.

        When dealing with SQLServer, dbo.dtproperties was showing up on the list of tables even though it was a system table. The other system tables weren't appearing.

        Parameters:
        data - Object describing data connection
        catalog - Name of catalog for item in database
        schema - Name of schema for item in database
        item - Name of item in database
        Returns:
        True if item is to be included in report
